column4: The configuration defaults for GNOME Power Manager  have not been installed correctly. Contact system administrator.
Hi.  Anyone know how to repair this: The configuration defaults for GNOME Power Manager  have not been installed correctly. Contact system administrator ????????????????????????????
Hi.  Anyone know how to repair this: The configuration defaults for GNOME Power Manager  have not been installed correctly. Contact system administrator ????????????????????????????
google "The configuration have not gnome power manager"
Its turning up many results though
Ok, ill try to find a reasonable solution
people suggest reinstall package or else do "dkpg reconfigure"
Some people seem to reinstall the entire desktop. Dont do that ;) .. Better to learn how to deal with problems + you learn things about the underlying technologies.
it says... "Then i deleted( use rm command to delete ) those bulkies to freeup the memory space.Then i restarted( shutdown -r 0) the system."
priv ? ... id like to debug this if possible
some people suggest to edit Menu.lst in order to deactivate  the ACPI
